title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 96.1 - Pre-season filing requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 96.1 - Pre-season filing requirements

State Regulations
(a) Every
licensee shall file with the Department of Taxation and Finance, not less than
10 days before the opening of each race meeting which it conducts, a notice of
the time and place, together with a complete description of the system and
samples of all forms to be used at such race meeting for controlling
admissions. In the event that such system or forms are not satisfactory to the

Department of Taxation and Finance, the licensee shall make such changes
therein as the commission may require. (b) Every licensee shall also, not less than
10 days before the opening of each race meeting conducted by it, file with the

Department of Taxation and Finance an affidavit by the printer of any tickets
to be used thereat, fully describing all such tickets and their distinguishing
characteristics, and stating the number of tickets of each type printed or to
be printed. Samples of each type of such tickets shall be submitted with such
affidavit. In the event that any such tickets are not satisfactory to the

Department of Taxation and Finance, the licensee shall make such changes
therein as the Department of Taxation and Finance may require. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
96.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
